newsitem.title: RUSSIA: AGROKHLEB - Weather favours Russian 97 spring sowing.
newsitem.headline: AGROKHLEB - Weather favours Russian 97 spring sowing.

text.p: The following is a direct contribution from SovEcon Ltd, an independent research organisation specialising in agricultural production and trade in the former Soviet Union.
RUSSIA: WEATHER FAVOURS 1997 SPRING GRAIN SOWING CAMPAIGN

MOSCOW, May 8 - The spring grain sowing campaign had started in all Russian regions, including the Urals, Western and Eastern Siberia, by the end of April, reflecting favourable weather conditions in most grain producing regions.

Early large-scale spring grain sowing in the Urals and Siberia was mainly behind the accelerated spring grain planting progress in Russia as a whole. This year's spring grain planting campaign has therefore caught up with normal levels.
Reseeded winter planting areas remain negligible so far, accounting for 1.2 percent of the total area compared with 2.4 and 7.2 percent on the same dates in 1996 and 1995 respectively.
Assuming normal crop development, SovEcon's forecast for Russia's total net grain output is tentatively put at the range of 70-75 million tonnes, against 69.3 million tonnes.
TABLE 1. RUSSIA - SPRING GRAIN PLANTING* BY REGIONS UP TO
Region Total sown area Of which 1997
* - not including corn plantings, plantings of private farms.
